resp:
Here are the steps to determine whether the claim about the table is TRUE or FALSE:

1. Check if there is a nomination for "best new musical" category: According to the table, in 2008, Rob Howell was nominated for the "best new musical" award.

2. Check if there are nominations for other categories where the same nominee (Rob Howell) was also nominated: Looking at the table, we can see that Rob Howell was also nominated for "best set design", "best costume design", and "best lighting design" all in 2008.

3. Since there is only one category ("best new musical") where the nomination was not shared with any other nominee (the rest of the nominations were shared) , we can now check if that is a different category from the rest . There are four categories, namely best set design , best costume design, best lighting design and best sound design which have been shared by 2 nominees. Hence it makes the claim FALSE.

4. Counting the total number of categories for which Rob Howell was nominated : we can see that he was nominated for 5 different categories namely Best New Musical and other four mentioned earlier.
